Name: Shawabti of Sennedjem
Description: The funerary shawabti is a statuette intended to perform work in place of the deceased in the underworld. The shawabti of Sennedjem, the chief craftsman of Deir el-Medina, is in the form of a mummy with arms crossed on the chest. The statuette wears a long black wig lined in yellow with yellow bands at the ends. The face is painted red and the eyes and eyebrows are black. Around the neck is a necklace with bands of black, red, and green strokes with a row of lotus petals at the bottom. The two baskets behind each shoulder are incised and painted yellow. Around the front and sides of the body are eight lines of incised hieroglyphs filled with black paint. The inscription gives the short version of Chapter 6 of the Book of the Dead.
